text:
Adult Education Entrepreneur Receives International Award
[Margrét Sverrisdóttir](https://epale.ec.europa.eu/is/users/margret-sverrisdottir)is licensed under
[All rights reserved]
Last October 3rd, Björg Árnadóttir, a passionate Icelandic writer, journalist and adult educator who has dedicated her career to fostering creativity and inclusivity through writing, received the international GlobalWIIN 2024 Award (Global Women Invention and Innovation Network) for “outstanding tenacity and commitment capable of impacting lives.”
Björg is known in Iceland and beyond for her pioneering work in developing creative, empowering, and inclusive learning environments for people in general, for vulnerable groups in particular, as well as for published authors, to write and share their life experiences.
Founded in 2015, Björg´s company Stílvopnið’s obvious goal is to nurture writing skills through courses, coaching, workshops and writing excursions. However, there is a hidden agenda; Björg’s endless effort to promote communication and co-creation across physical and social boundaries.
Björg has decades of experience in Nordic and European collaboration and loves participating in new projects. She communicates in Icelandic, English and Swedish.
PICTURE: Abdul Rahim, Director of Innovation at SHIFT, Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park, presents Björg Árnadóttir with the GlobalWIIN 2024 award.
